source_text: A $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) is a simple device-- when inserted into a $(thing)CAD$(0)'s $(l:components/socket)$(thing)Socket$(0)$(/l), it simply provides its contained $(thing)Spell$(0)'s data (and metadata) to the $(thing)CAD$(0).$(p)But $(thing)Bullets$(0) come in several types, each with their own merits.$(p)Each entry linked on the next page has more detailed information on that type of $(thing)Bullet$(0).
target_text: $(thing)スペル弾丸$(0)は単純なデバイスです。$(thing)CAD$(0)の$(l:components/socket)$(thing)ソケット$(0)$(/l)に挿入されると、単に含まれる$(thing)スペル$(0)のデータ(およびメタデータ)を$(thing)CAD$(0)に提供します。$(p)しかし、$(thing)弾丸$(0)はいくつかのタイプで提供され、それぞれに独自の長所があります。$(p)次のページにリンクされた各エントリは、その$(thing)弾丸$(0)のタイプについてのより詳細な情報があります。

source_text: If you want a specific type of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0), here you go.
target_text: 特定のタイプの$(thing)スペル弾丸$(0)が必要な場合は、ここです。

source_text: Many $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) types introduce a delay between when the $(thing)Spell$(0) is cast, and when it actually gets executed.$(p)Thus, it's important to note that the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) of a $(thing)Spell$(0) being cast is paid upfront in full, and is non-refundable-- even if the $(thing)Tricks$(0) in the $(thing)Spell$(0) don't actually get cast.
target_text: 多くの$(thing)スペル弾丸$(0)タイプは、$(thing)スペル$(0)がキャストされるときと、実際に実行されるときの間に遅延を導入します。$(p)したがって、$(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)コスト$(0)$(/l)が前払いで完全に支払われ、払い戻し不可であることに注意することが重要です。$(thing)スペル$(0)内の$(thing)トリック$(0)が実際にキャストされないとしても。

source_text: When you open up your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l), you'll see a large grid-- this is where $(thing)Spells$(0) are made, and where the magic happens.$(p)$(thing)Psi$(0)'s programming system isn't $(o)exactly$() a traditional, complex one; instead, $(thing)Spells$(0) are composed of simple actions, called $(thing)Tricks$(0), executed in order.$(p)The whole mod centers around simply getting $(thing)Tricks$(0) to do what you want them to.
target_text: $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)スペル Programmer$(0)$(/l)を開くと、大きなグリッドが表示されます。ここが$(thing)スペル$(0)が作成され、魔法が起こる場所です。$(p)$(thing)Psi$(0)のプログラミングシステムは、$(o)正確には$()従来の複雑なシステムではありません。代わりに、$(thing)スペル$(0)は$(thing)Trick$(0)と呼ばれる単純なアクションで構成されており、順番に実行されます。$(p)mod全体は、単に$(thing)Trick$(0)にあなたが望むことをさせることを中心にしています。

source_text: Open up your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l) and take a look at your "Debug" $(thing)Spell$(0) again.$(p)Remember the "Number" parameter on $(piece)Trick: Debug$(0) that we saw in $(l:basics/tutorial_1)the first tutorial$(/l)? We mentioned previously that that parameter has an extra dot in the center, meaning it can be disabled. But this time, we $(o)won't$() disable it.

source_text: Of course, the true power of a $(piece)Connector$(0) is that they can connect to each $(o)other$(): so you can of course daisy-chain them together to connect $(thing)Spell Pieces$(0) from as far-away as you please.$(p)Play around with some $(piece)Connectors$(0), and as soon as you feel comfortable with them you can move on to $(l:basics/tutorial_5)the next tutorial$(/l)!

source_text: To run your new-and-improved Debug $(thing)Spell$(0), you might believe that you need to unload the bullet, re-copy the $(thing)Spell$(0), reload the bullet, and re-select the $(thing)Spell$(0).$(p)Luckily, your $(thing)CAD$(0) comes with a shortcut: simply select your Debug $(thing)Spell$(0) on your $(thing)CAD$(0) crouch and swipe ($(k:use)) your $(thing)CAD$(0) over your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l), and the $(thing)Spell$(0) stored in the corresponding bullet will update itself to the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l)'s version.

These numerical stats define the practical limits on exactly what $(thing)Spells$(0) you're able to cast.

source_text: The first stat is $(thing)Complexity$(0), the total number of $(thing)Operators$(0), $(thing)Selectors$(0), and non-debug $(thing)Tricks$(0) in the $(thing)Spell$(0).$(p)Its maximum value is determined by the $(l:components/core)$(thing)CAD Core$(0)$(/l) you have installed; if a $(thing)Spell$(0)'s $(thing)Complexity$(0) exceeds your $(thing)CAD$(0)'s capacity, it won't be castable.

source_text: The second is $(thing)Potency$(0), capped by your $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)Assembly$(0)$(/l) component; the approximate total power draw of all $(thing)Tricks$(0) used in the $(thing)Spell$(0).$(p)Some $(thing)Tricks$(0) have a fixed $(thing)Potency$(0) cost per-use. However, most $(thing)Tricks$(0) that have a Number Constant-type parameter use it to determine their $(thing)Potency$(0); the higher the constant, the greater the $(thing)Potency$(0).
target_text: 次の統計は$(thing)効力$(0)であり、パラメータが個別にコストを追加し、$(thing)スペル$(0)がキャストされるたびに合計がユーザーの$(thing)Psiエネルギー$(0)から引き出されます。

source_text: The third stat, $(thing)Cost$(0), is unique in that your $(thing)CAD$(0) sets no limits on it. Instead, each time a $(thing)Spell$(0) is cast, it consumes its $(thing)Cost$(0) from your own body's $(thing)Psi energy$(0).$(p)The first number shown is the $(o)ideal$() $(thing)Cost$(0) of the $(thing)Spell$(0)-- all $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)CAD Assemblies$(0)$(/l) have flaws that increase it.
target_text: $(thing)投影$()は、$(thing)スペル$()が同時に実行できる「実際の」$(thing)トリック$()の数です。いくつかの$(thing)トリック$()は複数の投影を消費しますが、ほとんどは1つだけです。

source_text: The true $(thing)Cost$(0) of casting with your $(thing)CAD$(0) is the parenthesized number on the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l) display, and the higher an $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)Assembly$(0)$(/l)'s $(thing)Efficiency$(0), the closer to ideal the actual $(thing)Cost$(0) of casting from your $(thing)CAD$(0) becomes.
target_text: 最後に、$(thing)可能性$(0)は、$(thing)スペル$(0)の$(thing)フォーカルポイント$(0)から実行できる最大距離（ブロック単位）です。いくつかの$(thing)スペルピース$(0)はそれを減らします。

source_text: Note that if you cast a $(thing)Spell$(0) without enough $(thing)Psi energy$(0) available (known as $(l)overdrawing$()), your $(thing)CAD$(0) will draw the excess cost from your own health, and promptly disable itself until your $(thing)Psi energy$(0) fully regenerates, for your own protection.$(p)A $(l:components/battery)$(thing)Battery$(0)$(/l) added to a $(thing)CAD$(0) can guard against this.$(p)Be careful-- overdrawing has consequences that are painful, and maybe even lethal!
target_text: 注意：$(thing)Psi energy$(0)（「$(l)overdrawing$(）」として知られている）が十分にない状態で$(thing)Spell$(0)をキャストすると、あなたの$(thing)CAD$(0)はあなた自身の健康から過剰なコストを取り出し、あなたを保護するために$(thing)Psi energy$(0)が完全に回復するまで、すぐに自分自身を無効にします。$(p)$(thing)CAD$(0)に追加された$(l:components/battery)$(thing)Battery$(0)$(/l)はこれから保護することができます。$(p)注意してください-- overdrawingは痛みがあり、致命的なこともあります！

source_text: The fourth stat displayed on the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l) is $(thing)Projection$(0): the total number of non-debug $(thing)Tricks$(0) in the $(thing)Spell$(0).$(p)Your $(thing)CAD$(0)'s $(l:components/core)$(thing)Core$(0)$(/l) determines your maximum $(thing)Projection$(0) per-$(thing)Spell$(0); too many $(thing)Tricks$(0) and the $(thing)Spell$(0) is uncastable.
target_text: $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l)に表示される4番目のステータスは$(thing)投影$(0)です：$(thing)Spell$(0)内のデバッグではない$(thing)Tricks$(0)の総数。$(p)あなたの$(thing)CAD$(0)の$(l:components/core)$(thing)Core$(0)$(/l)は、$(thing)Spell$(0)ごとの最大$(thing)投影$(0)を決定します。$(thing)Tricks$(0)が多すぎると、$(thing)Spell$(0)はキャスト不可能になります。

source_text: And the fifth and final stat is $(thing)Bandwidth$(0), capped by your $(l:components/socket)$(thing)CAD Socket$(0)$(/l): the width or height of the $(thing)Spell$(0), measured in grid spaces-- whichever is larger.$(p)This is, with a bit of ingenuity, one of the more interesting stats to work with; if your $(thing)Spell$(0) is too big, the technique of moving some pieces around and eliminating others to pack it into a smaller space is known as $(l)compression$().
target_text: コアが投影を「使い果たし」た場合、コアは一度に別の$(thing)トリック$()を実行することはできません。むしろ、それはそれらを段階的に実行し、複数の実行フェーズで実行する必要があります。

source_text: To write this $(thing)Spell$(0), let's start with the $(thing)Trick$(0) we'll use to cause an explosion, and work backwards.$(p)Conveniently, it's named $(piece)Trick: Explode$(0)-- so open up your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l), clear out the grid, and place a $(piece)Trick: Explode$(0) near the middle.$(p)Shift-hovering over it reveals that it accepts a Vector and a Number Constant as parameters.
target_text: このページでは、重要な$(thing)スペル$(0)を書いています。あなたの成功を願っています。本当に。このセクションはかなり重要であり、あなたがスペルを書き始めると、あなたが知る必要があることを説明します。

source_text: Magnitudes are a bit harder to calculate for vectors that $(o)aren't$() mostly zeroes.$(p)However, since the $(o)x$(), $(o)y$(), and $(o)z$() directions are all at right angles, we can use the well-known Pythagorean Theorem to calculate any vector's magnitude.$(p)In particular, the magnitude for a vector [$(o)p$(), $(o)q$(), $(o)r$()] is the number √($(o)p$()²+$(o)q$()²+$(o)r$()²).
target_text: 大きさはほぼ0ではないベクトルについて計算するのはもう少し難しいです。$(p)しかし、$(o)x$()、$(o)y$()、$(o)z$()方向はすべて直角であるため、ピタゴラスの定理をよく知られた方法で使用して、任意のベクトルの大きさを計算できます。$(p)特に、ベクトル[$(o)p$()、$(o)q$()、$(o)r$()]の大きさは√($(o)p$()²+$(o)q$()²+$(o)r$()²)です。

source_text: For example, the magnitude of the vector [3, -4, 0] is √(3²+(-4)²+0²), which comes out to exactly 5.$(p)(Most of the time, a vector magnitude doesn't come out to a whole number, though.)$(p)Note that, while you $(o)can$() find the magnitude of a position vector, the number you get is largely meaningless-- who $(o)cares$() about your distance from [0, 0, 0] (which is some arbitrary point near bedrock and world spawn)?
target_text: たとえば、ベクトル[3、-4、0]の大きさは√(3²+(-4)²+0²)で、正確に5になります。$(p)(ただし、ほとんどの場合、ベクトルの大きさは全体的な数字ではなくなります。)$(p)位置ベクトルの大きさは$(o)見つけることができます$()が、得られた数値はほぼ意味がありません。[0、0、0]からの距離について誰$(o)気にします$()か(これは基盤と世界スポーン付近の任意のポイント)？

source_text: Almost all vectors also have $(l)directions$().$(p)An offset vector's direction is, well, the direction something would move if it followed the vector in a straight line.$(p)For example, the direction of [0, 1, 0] is simply straight up.$(p)The vector [1, 0, -1], on the other hand, represents one block east and one block north, so its direction is just straight ahead, due northeast.
target_text: ほぼすべてのベクトルには$(l)方向$()もあります。$(p)オフセットベクトルの方向は、ベクトルを直線で従った場合、何かが動くであろう方向です。$(p)たとえば、[0、1、0]の方向は単に真上です。$(p)一方、ベクトル[1、0、-1]は東に1ブロック、北に1ブロックを表すため、その方向は北東に真っ直ぐ前方にあります。

source_text: (Most directions aren't so nice, usually looking like "36.86 degrees north of west, 22.62 degrees below the horizon.")$(p)Note that the only vector without a direction is [0, 0, 0] (the $(l)zero vector$()), since you have to be going somewhere $(o)else$() to have a direction.$(p)Note that the direction of a position vector is almost as meaningless as its magnitude-- most $(thing)Spells$(0) don't need to know "where should I go to get away from bedrock at world spawn."
target_text: (ほとんどの方向はそれほど素敵ではなく、通常「西の36.86度北、地平線の下22.62度」のようになります。)$(p)唯一の方向がないベクトルは[0、0、0](ゼロベクトル)であることに注意してください。なぜなら、別の場所$(o)に行く$()必要があるからです。$(p)位置ベクトルの方向はその大きさとほぼ同じくらい意味がありません。ほとんどの$(thing)スペル$(0)は「基盤で世界スポーンから逃げるにはどこに行くべきか」を知る必要がありません。

source_text: As a matter of fact, you can reconstruct any vector, given only its magnitude and direction, into a list of three numbers (which are known as the $(l)components$() of the vector).$(p)For example, the direction "up" and the magnitude 1 correspond to the vector [0, 1, 0].$(p)This isn't as surprising as it may seem: after all, if someone tells you which direction to go, and how far, you should know they want you to be.
target_text: 実際、任意のベクトルは、その大きさと方向が与えられれば、3つの数字のリストに再構築できます(ベクトルの$(l)コンポーネント$()として知られています)。$(p)たとえば、方向「up」と大きさ1はベクトル[0、1、0]に対応します。$(p)これは思ったほど驚くべきことではありません。結局のところ、誰かがどの方向に行くべきか、そしてどのくらい遠くに行くべきか教えてくれたら、彼らはあなたがそこにいることを望んでいることを知っているべきです。

source_text: There are several simple ways to manipulate position and offset vectors.$(p)First, we can add a position and an offset vector to get another position vector, as we did earlier with the grass block example.$(p)On the other hand, we can of course $(o)subtract$() two position vectors to get the offset vector representing the offset from one to the other:$(br)[$(o)x$(), $(o)y$()+1, $(o)z$()] − [$(o)x$(), $(o)y$(), $(o)z$()] = [0, 1, 0].
target_text: 位置とオフセットベクトルを操作する簡単な方法があります。$(p)最初に、位置とオフセットベクトルを追加して別の位置ベクトルを取得できます。これは、芝ブロックの例で前に行ったことです。$(p)一方、もちろん$(o)減算$()できます。2つの位置ベクトルを使用して、1つから他方へのオフセットを表すオフセットベクトルを取得します。$(br)[$(o)x$()、$(o)y$()+1、$(o)z$()] - [$(o)x$()、$(o)y$()、$(o)z$()] = [0、1、0]。

source_text: Perhaps more interestingly, we can add two offset vectors, to get a single offset representing their combination.$(p)Adding this offset to a position vector would be equivalent to first adding one of its components to that position vector, then adding the other.
target_text: より興味深いことに、2つのオフセットベクトルを追加して、それらの組み合わせを表す単一のオフセットを取得できます。$(p)このオフセットを位置ベクトルに追加することは、最初にそのコンポーネントの1つをその位置ベクトルに追加し、次に他方を追加することと同等です。

source_text: And last, but most certainly not least, of the simple operations: we can $(l)scale$() a vector, by multiplying it by a number.$(p)Note that we're multiplying it by a number, and $(o)not$() another vector.$(p)If we wish to scale an vector [$(o)p$(), $(o)q$(), $(o)r$()] by a factor $(o)n$(), we simply multiply each of the vector's components by $(o)n$():$(br)$(o)n$()·[$(o)p$(), $(o)q$(), $(o)r$()] = [$(o)n$()·$(o)p$(), $(o)n$()·$(o)q$(), $(o)n$()·$(o)r$()].
target_text: そして最後に、最も単純な操作の中でも最も重要な操作：数値を乗算することでベクトルを$(l)スケーリング$()できます。$(p)数値を乗算することであり、$(o)別のベクトルではないこと$()に注意してください。$(p)ベクトル[$(o)p$()、$(o)q$()、$(o)r$()] を係数 $(o)n$() でスケーリングしたい場合、ベクトルの各コンポーネントに $(o)n$() を乗算するだけです。$(br)$(o)n$()·[$(o)p$()、$(o)q$()、$(o)r$()] = [$(o)n$()·$(o)p$()、$(o)n$()·$(o)q$()、$(o)n$()·$(o)r$()]。

source_text: This final operation relates nicely indeed to the concepts of magnitude and direction.$(p)When you scale a vector by a number $(o)n$(), you:$(p)$(li)multiply its magnitude by the absolute value of $(o)n$(), and$(p)$(li)don't change its direction if $(o)n$() is positive, but reverse its direction if $(o)n$() is negative.$(p)If $(o)n$()=0, then of course the resulting vector is the zero vector.
target_text: この最後の操作は、大きさと方向の概念にうまく関連しています。$(p)ベクトルを数値 $(o)n$() でスケーリングするときは、次の操作を行います。$(p)$(li)大きさに $(o)n$() の絶対値を乗算し、$(p)$(li) $(o)n$() が正の場合は方向を変更せず、$(o)n$() が負の場合は方向を反転させます。$(p) $(o)n$()=0 の場合、結果として得られるベクトルはゼロベクトルです。

source_text: If, on the other hand, we set $(o)n$()=-1, then we get a vector with the same magnitude (since the absolute value of -1 is 1), but that points in the opposite direction (since -1 is negative).$(p)This vector is known as the $(l)negative$() of the original, and when the two are added we get the zero vector.$(p)This makes sense, since if we go in a direction, then go in the opposite direction for the same distance, our net movement is zero.
target_text: 一方、$(o)n$()=-1 を設定した場合、同じ大きさを持つベクトル(-1の絶対値は1なので)が得られますが、反対方向を向いています(-1は負なので)。$(p)このベクトルは元のベクトルの$(l)負数$()として知られており、2つを加算するとゼロベクトルが得られます。$(p)これは理にかなっています。方向に進み、次に同じ距離で反対方向に進む場合、純粋な動きはゼロだからです。

source_text: If, instead of multiplying, we $(o)divide$() a (nonzero) vector by its magnitude, we get a vector with magnitude 1 (since anything divided by itself is 1), but the same direction (since magnitudes are always positive).$(p)This is an important and well-known operation, known as $(l)normalizing$() a vector; the vector that results (and, in fact, any vector with magnitude 1) is called a $(l)unit vector$().
target_text: 乗算の代わりに、ゼロ以外のベクトルをその大きさで$(o)除算$()する場合、大きさ1のベクトル(何かをそれ自身で除算すると1になるため)が得られますが、同じ方向(大きさは常に正であるため)です。$(p)これは$(l)正規化$()と呼ばれる重要でよく知られた操作です。結果として得られるベクトル(そして実に、大きさ1のベクトル)は、$(l)単位ベクトル$()と呼ばれています。

source_text: Congratulations on making it through this tutorial!$(p)Again, this is just an introduction to vectors-- I've not said anything about dot or cross products, or vector projections, for example.$(p)But this should be more than enough to put together some quite interesting $(thing)Spells$(0) already.$(p)That's all-- now go forth and spellsling!
target_text: このチュートリアルを完成させてくれておめでとうございます！$(p)繰り返しますが、これはベクトルへのイントロダクションに過ぎません。たとえば、ドット積やクロス積、またはベクトル投影については何も述べていません。$(p)しかし、これは既に非常に興味深い$(thing)スペル$(0)を組み立てるには十分以上です。$(p)それで全部です。さあ、スペルスリンギングに行きましょう！

source_text: However, $(o)within$() the context of $(thing)Psi$(0), putting offset and position vectors where they don't belong can lead to unpredictable results indeed.$(p)Two rules of thumb:$(p)$(li)Most $(thing)Operators$(0) that accept vectors should take no more than one position vector;$(p)$(li)Most $(thing)Tricks$(0) that affect blocks should take $(o)only$() a position vector.$(p)These are general rules, though; some $(thing)Spell Pieces$(0) do act differently.
target_text: ただし、$(o)Psi$()のコンテキスト内では、オフセットベクトルと位置ベクトルを不適切な場所に配置すると、予測不可能な結果につながる可能性があります。$(p)経験則として2つあります：$(p)$(li)ほとんどの$(thing)オペレーター$()がベクトルを受け入れる場合、位置ベクトルは1つまで；$(p)$(li)ブロックに影響するほとんどの$(thing)トリック$()は、$(o)位置$()ベクトルのみを受け取ります。$(p)これらは一般的なルールですが、一部の$(thing)スペルピース$()は異なる動作をします。

source_text: Offset vectors have $(l)magnitudes$().$(p)You can think of an offset vector's magnitude as its "length," or the distance between a position in the world, and that same position when the offset vector is added to it.$(p)For example, our earlier offset vector [0, 1, 0] simply moved the position one block-length up, so it had a length, and therefore a magnitude, of 1.
target_text: オフセットベクトルは$(l)大きさ$(/)を持ちます。$(p)オフセットベクトルの大きさは、その「長さ」、または世界内の位置と、そのオフセットベクトルが追加されたときの同じ位置との間の距離として考えることができます。$(p)例えば、前述のオフセットベクトル[0、1、0]は位置を1ブロック分上に移動しただけなので、長さ、つまり大きさが1でした。

source_text: Since a distance is always positive, so are vectors' magnitudes.$(p)Consider the vector [0, -3, 0] as an example: it represents down, three blocks-- yet the total distance moved is three blocks, and the "down" bit doesn't matter.$(p)Therefore, the magnitude of this vector is $(l)positive$() 3.
target_text: 距離は常に正であるため、ベクトルの大きさも同じです。$(p)例としてベクトル[0、-3、0]を考えます：これは下、3ブロックを表します。ただし、移動した総距離は3ブロックであり、「下」は関係ありません。$(p)したがって、このベクトルの大きさは$(l)正$(/)の3です。

source_text: Beep boop! Seems like you're importing a spell created on an older Psi version. If that spell contains motion or sequence tricks, the same functionality( and cost) as when it was created is not assured.
target_text: ビープブープ！古いPsiバージョンで作成されたスペルをインポートしているようです。そのスペルにモーションまたはシーケンストリックが含まれている場合、作成時と同じ機能(およびコスト)は保証されません。

source_text: These both take a position vector, and respectively place and break a block at that position. $(piece)Trick: Place Block$(0) uses the block to the right of your $(thing)CAD$(0) in your hotbar for placing. Knowing the block position to break is easy; $(piece)Operator: Vector Raycast$(0) suffices.
target_text: これらはどちらも位置ベクトルを取り、それぞれその位置にブロックを配置・破壊します。$(piece)トリック：ブロック配置$(0)は、あなたの$(thing)CAD$(0)のホットバーの右にあるブロックを使用します。$(p)$(piece)トリック：ブロック破壊$(0)を使用してブロックを破壊する場合は、プレイヤーが見ているブロックについて心配する必要があります。

source_text: However, placing a block is trickier: $(piece)Operator: Vector Raycast$(0) gives us the block the player is looking at. We can't place a block there-- there already $(o)is$() one! To remedy that, we can combine our $(piece)Operator: Vector Raycast$(0) with the $(piece)Operator: Vector Axis Raycast$(0) piece, which gives us a vector representing the side of the block we're looking at.
target_text: しかし、ブロックの配置はより複雑です：$(piece)オペレーター：ベクトル光線キャスト$(0)は、プレイヤーが見ているブロックをくれます。その場所にはブロックを配置できません--既に$(o)ある$()からです！これを改善するために、$(piece)トリック：ブロック破壊$(0)を配置したいブロックの前に使用してください。

source_text: The other two $(thing)Tricks$(0) available here are $(piece)Trick: Place Block Sequence$(0) and $(piece)Trick: Break Block Sequence$(0). These $(thing)Tricks$(0) break or place a line of blocks. Similarly to the standard break and place $(thing)Tricks$(0), they require a position to start off, but they also require another Vector, "Target", that defines the direction to operate in. So if "Target" is [0, 1, 0], it'll place or break blocks starting from the value of "Position" upwards.
target_text: ここで利用可能な他の2つの$(thing)トリック$(0)は$(piece)トリック：ブロック配置シーケンス$(0)および$(piece)トリック：ブロック破壊シーケンス$(0)です。これらの$(thing)トリック$(0)はブロック行を破壊または配置します。設定済みの$(thing)ベクトル$(0)方向に、ブロック番号を配置します。

source_text: You start off by finding the vector that you want to place blocks along, so you can plug it into $(piece)Trick: Place Block Sequence$(0). If you're diagonal to the block, though, you may get something like [3, 2, 4]. That's not a straight line! We can use $(piece)Operator: Vector Project$(0) to project that into the axis of the side you're looking at, say, [0, 0, 1].
target_text: 最初に、$(piece)トリック：ブロック配置シーケンス$(0)に接続するベクトルを見つけます。ブロックに対して斜めの場合、不規則な配置が得られる可能性があります。

source_text: By default, whenever a $(thing)Spell$(0) is cast, its value is "Relative 1", so it's 1 slot to the right of your $(thing)CAD$(0). If it was "Relative -1" it would be 1 slot to the left of your $(thing)CAD$(0). "Absolute 3" would be the third slot in your hotbar. It also loops around, so if you have your $(thing)CAD$(0) on your last slot and the value is "Relative 1", it'll be your first slot.
target_text: デフォルトでは、$(thing)呪文$(0)がキャストされるたびに、その値は「相対1」であるため、$(thing)CAD$(0)の右側に1スロットあります。「相対-1」の場合、$(thing)CAD$(0)の左側に1スロットになります。

source_text: To set the focused slot, you can use $(piece)Trick: Switch Focus Slot$(0). This takes one of 2 parameters. Both are optional and mutually exclusive, and if you don't define any, it'll set the focus to the default of "Relative 1". If you choose to set the "Position" parameter, it'll set an Absolute value, whereas the "Shift" parameter will set a Relative value.
target_text: フォーカススロットを設定するには、$(piece)トリック：フォーカススロット切り替え$(0)を使用できます。これは2つのパラメーターのいずれかを取ります。どちらも省略可能で相互に排他的です。定義しない場合は、フォーカスをリセットします。

source_text: This allows you to, for example, build things with different blocks based on the circumstance. This $(thing)Trick$(0) only works for the current $(thing)Spell$(0) cast, and the focus will reset the next time a $(thing)Spell$(0) is cast (even if it's the same $(thing)Spell$(0)).$(p)The other two pieces in the group are set in the "detection" area.
target_text: これにより、たとえば、状況に基づいて異なるブロックで物を構築できます。この$(thing)トリック$(0)は現在の$(thing)呪文$(0)キャストにのみ機能し、フォーカスはキャスト後にリセットされます。

source_text: Lastly, $(piece)Selector: Block Presence$(0) takes a vector, to be used as coordinates in the world, and finds the block there, the value returned is 0 if there's no block or a replaceable block (like tall grass), 1 if it's a non-solid block and 2 if it's a solid block.
target_text: 最後に、$(piece)セレクター：ブロック存在$(0)はベクトルを取ります。これは世界座標として使用されます。そこにあるブロックを見つけ、返される値は、ブロックがないか置換可能なブロックがある場合は0です。

source_text: At the push of a button
target_text: ボタンの押下時

source_text: A very simple way to put $(piece)Trick: Die$(0) to use is to couple it to $(piece)Selector: Sneak Status$(0), which conveniently returns 0 if the caster is sneaking and 1 if they're not.$(p)Why, it's almost as if they were made to be used together!
target_text: $(piece)トリック：死$(0)を使用する非常に簡単な方法は、それを$(piece)セレクター：スニーク状態$(0)に結合することです。スニークしている場合は0を、スニークしていない場合は1を返すのが便利です。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell Circle$(0) drains all the $(thing)Psi energy$(0) it needs when it's first cast, hence its $(thing)Cost Multiplier$(0) of a whopping 1500%%.$(p)However, its voracious $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) is not without benefit; its compact, self-contained design makes it $(o)extremely$() efficient, allowing it to execute a $(thing)Spell$(0) 20 times for the cost of 15.$(p)For those of you keeping track, that's a full 25%% discount per-execution.
target_text: $(thing)呪文サークル$(0)は、最初にキャストされるときに必要なすべての$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)を消費します。したがって、その$(thing)コスト乗数$(0)はなんと1500%%です。

source_text: The $(thing)Circlesync$(0) idiom, relatively simple to build, allows all twenty executions of the $(thing)Spell$(0) to happen at once, allowing them to accumulate into a much grander effect than a single execution would alone.$(p)The $(thing)20-Bit Tower$(0) idiom has a slightly more difficult setup involving a $(l:items/vector_ruler)$(item)Vector Ruler$(0)$(/l); but allows a $(thing)Spell$(0) to only do something on a subset of its twenty executions.
target_text: $(thing)Circlesync$(0)イディオムは、比較的単純に構築されており、すべて20の実行が一度に行われるようにできます。

source_text: The $(thing)20-Bit Tower$(0) idiom is a rather advanced technique, rather technical in design.$(p)To use it, select a block with a $(l:items/vector_ruler)$(item)Vector Ruler$(0)$(/l), then place some blocks (it doesn't matter what kind) in the twenty-block-high vertical space directly above the location you selected, then copy the code on the following page to the top of your $(thing)Spell$(0).
target_text: $(thing)20ビットタワー$(0)イディオムは、むしろ高度な技術で、設計上かなり技術的です。

source_text: A $(thing)Colorizer$(0) can be crafted with any of the sixteen vanilla $(item)Dyes$(0) for their respective colors.$(p)If $(item)Prismarine Crystals$(0) are used in place of a dye, the resulting $(thing)Colorizer$(0) will shift through the colors of the rainbow.$(p)If, on the other hand, $(o)no$() color item is used, the resulting $(thing)Colorizer$(0) will $(o)draw$() color $(o)out$() of the user's $(thing)Psi energy$(0), and the resulting particles will be nigh-invisible.
target_text: $(thing)着色器$(0)は、16のバニラ$(item)染料$(0)のいずれでも、それぞれの色で作成できます。

source_text: Using a piece of $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l) as the color item in the $(thing)Colorizer$(0) seems to have no known effect for most people, though certain individuals have reported differently.$(p)A $(thing)Colorizer$(0) in a $(thing)CAD$(0) affects:$(p)$(li)particles emitted by the $(thing)CAD$(0);$(p)$(li)projectiles and $(l:items/circle_bullet)$(thing)Spell Circles$(0)$(/l) cast;$(p)$(li)blocks and lights conjured by the $(piece)conjuration tricks$(0).
target_text: $(l:components/psidust)$(item)サイダスト$(0)$(/l)の一片を$(thing)着色器$(0)の色アイテムとして使用すると、ほとんどの人には既知の効果がないようですが、特定の個人は報告されています。

source_text: If we use $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigems$(0)$(/l) in a $(thing)CAD Core$(0) with $(item)Glowstone Dust$(0) at its center, we get a $(item)Radiative CAD Core$(0).$(p)This $(thing)Core$(0) has a lesser $(l:basics/tutorial_5#projection)$(thing)Projection$(0)$(/l) than the $(l:components/core#hyperclocked)$(item)Hyperclocked$(0)$(/l) one, but has the capability to execute a staggering $(o)seven$() $(thing)Tricks$(0) per-cast.
target_text: $(l:components/psigem)$(item)サイジェム$(0)$(/l)を$(thing)CADコア$(0)で使用し、中央に$(item)グロースストーンダスト$(0)がある場合、$(item)放射性CADコア$(0)を取得します。

source_text: Crafted from an $(item)Iron$(0) shell around a piece of $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l), the $(item)Basic CAD Core$(0) is often the first $(thing)CAD Core$(0) a mage crafts.$(p)It's not fantastic (in particular, it can only cast one $(thing)Trick$(0) at a time), but it's quite sufficient for a beginner's needs.
target_text: $(item)鉄$(0)シェルの周り、$(l:components/psidust)$(item)サイダスト$(0)$(/l)の一片で製造された$(item)基本CADコア$(0)は、多くの場合、魔法使いが最初に製造する$(thing)CADコア$(0)です。

source_text: Substituting $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l) for $(item)Iron$(0) around a $(thing)CAD Core$(0) allows us to use a different dust component in the $(thing)Core$(0)'s center.$(p)If $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) is used for the dust, we get a $(item)Overclocked CAD Core$(0), which boasts twice the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#complexity)$(thing)Complexity$(0)$(/l) of its $(l:components/core#basic)$(item)Basic$(0)$(/l) predecessor, and thrice the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#projection)$(thing)Projection$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)サイメタル$(0)$(/l)を$(item)鉄$(0)と交換して$(thing)CADコア$(0)の周りに置くと、$(thing)コア$(0)の中心で異なるダスト成分を使用できます。

source_text: If, instead, we place a piece of $(item)Glowstone Dust$(0) within a $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l) shell, we create a $(item)Conductive CAD Core$(0).$(p)This $(thing)Core$(0) handles less $(l:basics/tutorial_5#complexity)$(thing)Complexity$(0)$(/l) than its $(item)Redstone Dust$(0)-based counterpart, but can handle four $(thing)Tricks$(0) at once, over the $(l:components/core#overclocked)$(item)Overclocked$(0)$(/l)'s three.
target_text: 代わりに、$(item)グロースストーンダスト$(0)を$(l:components/psimetal)$(item)サイメタル$(0)$(/l)シェル内に配置する場合、$(item)導電性CADコア$(0)を作成します。

source_text: Embedding two $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigems$(0)$(/l) into the recipe for a $(thing)CAD Core$(0) creates $(o)serious$() performance benefits.$(p)The $(item)Hyperclocked CAD Core$(0), with $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) at its center, has double the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#complexity)$(thing)Complexity$(0)$(/l) of a $(l:components/core#conductive)$(item)Conductive$(0)$(/l) core $(o)and$() double the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#projection)$(thing)Projection$(0)$(/l) of an $(l:components/core#overclocked)$(item)Overclocked$(0)$(/l) one.
target_text: $(l:components/psigem)$(item)サイジェム$(0)$(/l)を2つ$(thing)CADコア$(0)のレシピに埋め込むと、深刻なパフォーマンス上の利点が得られます。

source_text: A $(item)Spell Detonator$(0) is crafted from two $(item)Iron Ingots$(0), $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l), and a $(item)Button$(0).$(p)It serves exactly one function: when it's actuated ($(k:use)), it activates every single $(l:items/charge_bullet)$(thing)Spell Charge$(0)$(/l) (and $(l:items/exosuit_sensor#trigger)$(item)Exosuit Detonation Sensor$(0)$(/l)) cast by you in a 32-block radius, instructing them to simultaneously execute their contained $(thing)Spells$(0).
target_text: $(item)呪文起動装置$(0)は、2つの$(item)鉄インゴット$(0)、$(l:components/psidust)$(item)サイダスト$(0)$(/l)、および$(item)ボタン$(0)から作成されます。

source_text: Unfortunately, as it turns out, neither $(item)Ebony$(0) nor $(item)Ivory Substance$(0) plays nicely with $(thing)Overworld$(0)-y materials.$(p)This means that fashioning them into $(l:components/core)$(thing)CAD Cores$(0)$(/l), $(l:components/socket)$(thing)Sockets$(0)$(/l), and $(l:components/battery)$(thing)Batteries$(0)$(/l) proves rather difficult.$(p)We $(o)can$(), however, coat $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal Ingots$(0)$(/l) with the stuff, yielding $(item)Ebony$(0) and $(item)Ivory Psimetal Ingots$(0), respectively, which are just about stable enough to be shaped into $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)CAD Assemblies$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 残念なことに、$(item)エボニー$(0)も$(item)象牙物質$(0)も$(thing)オーバーワールド$(0)のような材料とうまくいきません。

source_text: A $(thing)Psimetal Exosuit$(0) is a suit of armor allowing you to seamlessly integrate $(thing)Spell$(0)-casting into your everyday adventuring!$(p)Each piece of the $(thing)Exosuit$(0) is crafted from two $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigems$(0)$(/l) and some $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l), and is capable of casting a $(thing)Spell$(0) when its respective trigger is activated.
target_text: $(thing)サイメタルエクソスーツ$(0)は、呪文キャスティングを日常の冒険にシームレスに統合できるスーツです。

source_text: The suits' $(thing)Spells$(0) are cast with your $(thing)CAD$(0) as a focus, so the usual $(thing)CAD$(0) limits apply.$(p)Each piece of the $(thing)Psimetal Exosuit$(0) can be loaded with up to three $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) in a $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l), though sadly, some $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) variants don't play well with the suit.$(p)A suit piece remembers the number of times it's successfully cast a $(thing)Spell$(0); this count can be accessed from $(piece)Selector: Success Counter$(0).
target_text: スーツの$(thing)呪文$(0)は、フォーカスとして$(thing)CAD$(0)でキャストされるため、通常の$(thing)CAD$(0)の制限が適用されます。

source_text: $(item)Psimetal Exosuit Leggings$(0) $(o)never stop$() casting their selected $(thing)Spell$(0).$(p)In fact, they do so once per $(thing)CAD$(0) tick, which is a unit of time equal to 0.05 seconds.$(p)They're quite popular as "better $(l:items/loopcast_bullet)$(item)Loopcast Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l)."
target_text: $(item)サイメタルエクソスーツレギンス$(0)は、選択した$(thing)呪文$(0)のキャストを$(o)停止しません$()。

source_text: Once you've selected the suit piece you want to configure, choose one of the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) that's displayed the same way you would with your $(thing)CAD$(0).$(p)Selecting the empty fourth slot disables that suit piece completely-- no $(thing)Spells$(0) will be cast even if its activation criteria are met.
target_text: スーツピースを設定したら、$(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)呪文弾$(0)$(/l)の1つを選択します。

source_text: A $(thing)Psimetal Exosuit$(0) is slightly better than $(thing)Iron Armor$(0) in strength and durability.$(p)All pieces of a suit will draw from their wearer's excess $(thing)Psi energy$(0) to repair damage to themselves, a feat made possible by the $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigems$(0)$(/l) used in their construction.
target_text: $(thing)サイメタルエクソスーツ$(0)は、強度と耐久性において$(thing)鉄防具$(0)よりもわずかに優れています。

source_text: The $(item)Psimetal Exosuit Helmet$(0) is the most configurable of the bunch, casting its designated $(thing)Spell$(0) whenever its contained $(l:items/exosuit_sensor)$(thing)Exosuit Sensor$(0)$(/l) triggers.$(p)A $(l:items/exosuit_sensor)$(thing)Sensor$(0)$(/l) attaches to and detaches from a $(item)Helmet$(0) in a crafting grid; a $(item)Helmet$(0) can only have one $(l:items/exosuit_sensor)$(thing)Exosuit Sensor$(0)$(/l) attached at a time.
target_text: $(item)サイメタルエクソスーツヘルメット$(0)は、含まれている$(l:items/exosuit_sensor)$(thing)エクソスーツセンサー$(0)$(/l)がトリガーされるたびに指定された$(thing)呪文$(0)をキャストする最も設定可能なものです。

source_text: All $(thing)Sensors$(0) are crafted from two $(item)Iron Ingots$(0) and two of $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l) around a reagent; the reagent used determines the resulting $(thing)Sensor$(0)'s effect:$(p)$(li)the $(item)Light Sensor$(0) uses $(item)Glowstone Dust$(0);$(p)$(li)the $(item)Heat Sensor$(0) uses a $(item)Fire Charge$(0);$(p)$(li)the $(item)Stress Sensor$(0) uses a slice of $(item)Glistering Melon$(0);$(p)$(li)the $(item)Water Sensor$(0) uses $(item)Prismarine Crystals$(0);$(p)$(li)the $(item)Detonation Sensor$(0) uses $(item)Gunpowder$(0).
target_text: すべての$(thing)センサー$(0)は2つの$(item)鉄インゴット$(0)と2つの$(l:components/psimetal)$(item)サイメタル$(0)$(/l)で、試薬の周りで製造されます。

source_text: $(piece)Trick: Die$(0), on the other hand, is a Flow Control piece in the proper sense of the term.$(p)It takes a Number parameter, and if that number's absolute value lies strictly below 1 (also exclusive), it fizzles the $(thing)Spell$(0) right then and there. Any other values passed to the $(thing)Trick$(0) will allow the $(thing)Spell$(0) to continue on as usual.$(p)This piece doesn't cost $(l:basics/tutorial_5#projection)$(thing)Projection$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 一方、$(piece)トリック：死$(0)は、適切な意味でのフロー制御ピースです。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from a $(item)Grenade Spell Bullet$(0), instead of executing immediately, is fired out the end of the $(thing)CAD$(0) it was cast in a $(thing)Spell Grenade$(0).$(p)Unlike a $(l:items/projectile_bullet)$(thing)Spell Projectile$(0)$(/l), though, a grenade $(o)is$() affected by gravity.$(p)It executes its contained $(thing)Spell$(0) after exactly three seconds, no sooner and no later.
target_text: $(item)手榴弾呪文弾$(0)からキャストされた$(thing)呪文$(0)は、すぐに実行されるのではなく、$(thing)CAD$(0)の端から$(thing)呪文手榴弾$(0)の中で発火します。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell Grenade$(0) is an intangible thin wrapper of $(thing)Psi energy$(0), created from the excess drawn by the $(item)Grenade Spell Bullet$(0).$(p)The conjured grenade also acts as the $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Point$(0)$(/l) for the $(thing)Spell$(0) when it executes.$(p)While its uses appear rather limited at first, a $(thing)Spell Grenade$(0) can reach places a $(l:items/projectile_bullet)$(thing)Spell Projectile$(0)$(/l) can't (e.g. over a wall, or inside a hole).
target_text: $(thing)呪文手榴弾$(0)は$(item)手榴弾呪文弾$(0)が引き出す超過から作られた$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)の無形の薄いラッパーです。

source_text: Welcome to $(thing)Psi$(0), the greatest spell-program-based magitech mod this side of the universe!$(p)$(thing)Psi$(0) is a mod (inspired by a series called Mahouka) about creating and casting $(thing)Spells$(0) to do your bidding in the world around you.$(p)To begin your journey to become a spellslinging mage, you'll first need some $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l)-- however, one does not simply craft the stuff.
target_text: ようこそ$(thing)サイ$(0)へ。この宇宙の最高のスペル・プログラム・ベースのマギテックModです。

source_text: Instead, start by crafting a $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l) and an $(l:components/assembly#iron)$(item)Iron CAD Assembly$(0)$(/l).$(p)Place the $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l), open it, and insert the $(l:components/assembly#iron)$(item)Iron CAD Assembly$(0)$(/l) to construct a very bare-bones $(thing)Casting Assistant Device$(0) ($(thing)CAD$(0), for short).$(p)From there, drop some $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) on the ground, point your new $(thing)CAD$(0) at the dust, and cast ($(k:use)) to create some $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 代わりに、$(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CADアセンブラー$(0)$(/l)と$(l:components/assembly#iron)$(item)鉄CADアセンブリ$(0)$(/l)を作成することから始めます。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from a $(item)Loopcast Spell Bullet$(0) is executed as if from a plain $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l).$(p)Repeatedly.$(p)A $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from one of these $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) is executed over and over nonstop, four times a second, until the $(thing)CAD$(0) it was cast from stops being held in the same hand, or a different $(thing)Spell$(0) is selected.
target_text: $(item)ループキャスト呪文弾$(0)からキャストされた$(thing)呪文$(0)は、プレーンな$(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)呪文弾$(0)$(/l)からのように実行されます。

source_text: The $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Point$(0)$(/l) for a $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from a $(item)Loopcast Spell Bullet$(0) is just the caster, and the full $(thing)Psi energy$(0) cost is incurred on each execution.$(p)The major advantage of using one of these $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) over just casting repeatedly really fast lies in the $(o)regeneration$() of your $(thing)Psi energy$(0).
target_text: $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)焦点$(0)$(/l)は$(item)ループキャスト呪文弾$(0)からキャストされた$(thing)呪文$(0)については、ただキャスターであり、完全な$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)コストが適用されます。

source_text: When you cast a $(thing)Spell$(0) (or when you take damage), your $(thing)Psi energy$(0) is momentarily left in a state of disequilibrium; it can't regenerate until you can focus inward and restabilize it.$(br)While not difficult, this restabilization takes a bit of time to achieve.$(p)But when you cast from a $(item)Loopcast Spell Bullet$(0), this delay only occurs $(o)initially$()-- afterwards, the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullet$(0)$(/l) makes no disruptions in your $(thing)Psi energy$(0), allowing it to regenerate as normal.
target_text: 呪文をキャストする（またはダメージを受ける）ときは、$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)が一時的に不均衡状態のままになります。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from one of these $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) can do different things on each invocation.$(p)Specifically, $(piece)Selector: Loopcast Index$(0) returns the number of times the $(thing)Spell$(0) has been executed since you first cast it.$(p)Thus, it returns 1 the first time the $(thing)Spell$(0) executes, 2 the second time, and so on.
target_text: これらの$(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)弾$(0)$(/l)の1つからキャストされた$(thing)呪文$(0)は、各呼び出しで異なることを実行できます。

source_text: When used with $(piece)Operator: Integer Divide$(0) and $(piece)Operator: Modulus$(0), these $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) can perform operations $(o)en masse$() over wide areas with ease.
target_text: $(piece)オペレーター：整数除算$(0)および$(piece)オペレーター：剰余$(0)と共に使用されると、これらの$(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)弾$(0)$(/l)は広大な地域で$(o)一括$(0)操作を実行できます。

source_text: A $(thing)CAD$(0)'s $(thing)Memory Slots$(0) are numbered starting from 1, so a $(thing)CAD$(0) with 3 memory slots can save to slots 1, 2, and 3.$(p)Both $(thing)Tricks$(0) in this group add $(l:basics/tutorial_5#potency)$(thing)Potency$(0)$(/l) to $(thing)Spells$(0) they're used in equal to the number of the slot used.$(p)For example, saving to or loading from slot 2 costs two $(l:basics/tutorial_5#potency)$(thing)Potency$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(thing)CAD$(0)の$(thing)メモリスロット$(0)は1から始まるため、3つのメモリスロットを持つ$(thing)CAD$(0)はスロット1、2、および3に保存できます。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell$(0) cast from a $(item)Projectile Spell Bullet$(0) doesn't execute immediately.$(p)Instead, a fast-moving $(thing)Spell Projectile$(0) containing it is fired out the end of the $(thing)CAD$(0) from which it's cast.$(p)This projectile acts as the $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Point$(0)$(/l) for its $(thing)Spell$(0), executing it when the projectile collides with something.
target_text: $(item)射弾呪文弾$(0)からキャストされた$(thing)呪文$(0)はすぐには実行されません。

source_text: A $(thing)Spell Projectile$(0) isn't physical; instead, it's a thin wrapper of $(thing)Psi energy$(0) around its contained $(thing)Spell$(0) (hence the extra cost in the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullet$(0)$(/l)).$(p)As such, it can last for up to thirty seconds before dissipating.$(p)A $(thing)Spell Projectile$(0) moves quite swiftly, and can travel more than 200 blocks' distance without assistance in its lifespan.
target_text: $(thing)呪文射弾$(0)は物理的ではありません。代わりに、その中に含まれている$(thing)呪文$(0)の周り（したがって$(l:items/spell_bullet)$(th...にはコストが追加されている$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)のラッパーです。

source_text: $(item)Psidust$(0) is a material transmuted from $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) by an unfocused burst of $(thing)Psi energy$(0), and is, as such, a good conductor of said energies.$(p)Therefore, it's a critical component in low-tier $(thing)CADs$(0), since it's used in simple $(l:components/core#basic)$(thing)CAD Cores$(0)$(/l), $(l:components/socket#basic)$(thing)Sockets$(0)$(/l), and $(l:components/battery#basic)$(thing)Batteries$(0)$(/l), as well as all $(l:components/colorizer)$(thing)CAD Colorizers$(0)$(/l).$(p)It's also used in $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(item)サイダスト$(0)は、集中力を失った$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)のバーストによって$(item)レッドストーンダスト$(0)から伝達される材料です。したがって、これは良好な導体です。

source_text: To create $(item)Psidust$(0), first throw some $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) on the ground.$(p)Then, stand nearby and cast ($(k:use)) with a $(thing)CAD$(0) $(l)that has no $(thing)Spell$(0) selected$() to convert the redstone into $(item)Psidust$(0).$(p)$(item)Psidust$(0) can also be created with any of the $(piece)infusion tricks$(0).
target_text: $(item)サイダスト$(0)を作成するには、最初に$(item)レッドストーンダスト$(0)を地面に投げます。

source_text: $(item)Psigems$(0) are crystals transmuted from $(item)Diamonds$(0) whose refractive properties make them extraordinarily good at conducting, transferring, and storing $(thing)Psi energy$(0).$(p)These are used to fashion top-of-the-line $(l:components/core)$(thing)CAD Cores$(0)$(/l), $(l:components/socket)$(thing)Sockets$(0)$(/l), and $(l:components/battery#ultradense)$(thing)Batteries$(0)$(/l), and as essential components in $(l:items/tools)$(thing)Psimetal Tools$(0)$(/l) and $(l:items/exosuit)$(thing)Armor$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(item)サイジェム$(0)は、屈折特性により、$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)を伝導、転送、および保存するのに非常に優れています$(item)ダイヤモンド$(0)から伝達された結晶です。

source_text: $(item)Psimetal$(0) is a material transmuted from $(item)Gold Ingots$(0) that conducts, stores, and transfers $(thing)Psi energy$(0) $(o)much$() better than $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l) does.$(p)In addition to being a component in more powerful $(l:components/core)$(thing)CAD Cores$(0)$(/l), $(l:components/socket)$(thing)Sockets$(0)$(/l), and $(l:components/battery#extended)$(thing)Batteries$(0)$(/l), it can be fashioned into a superior $(l:components/assembly#psimetal)$(thing)CAD Assembly$(0)$(/l). It's also used to craft $(l:items/tools)$(thing)Psimetal Tools$(0)$(/l) and $(l:items/exosuit)$(thing)Armor$(0)$(/l), as well as $(l:components/ebony_ivory)$(item)Ebony & Ivory Ingots$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(item)サイメタル$(0)は、$(thing)サイエネルギー$(0)を伝導、保存、転送する$(item)ゴールドインゴット$(0)から伝達された材料です。

source_text: A $(thing)CAD$(0)'s $(thing)Socket$(0) is basically its bullet clip.$(p)It's what $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) are loaded into, and it's responsible for transferring the compiled $(thing)Spells$(0) contained within the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) to the $(l:components/core)$(thing)Core$(0)$(/l) for processing.$(p)$(thing)Sockets$(0) are crafted with a piece of dust, which interfaces with the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l), on a metallic substrate.
target_text: $(thing)CAD$(0)の$(thing)ソケット$(0)は基本的にそのプログラムクリップです。

source_text: A $(thing)Socket$(0) has a $(l:basics/tutorial_5#bandwidth)$(thing)Bandwidth$(0)$(/l), which is the maximum size (in grid spaces) of a $(thing)Spell$(0) that it can transfer to a $(l:components/core)$(thing)Core$(0)$(/l), all at once-- for example, a $(thing)Socket$(0) with bandwidth 5 could transfer a $(thing)Spell$(0) up to 5x5 in dimension.$(p)It also has, well, a number of $(thing)Sockets$(0), which are compartments that can hold one $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) each.
target_text: $(thing)ソケット$(0)には$(l:basics/tutorial_5#bandwidth)$(thing)帯域幅$(0)$(/l)があります。これは$(thing)呪文$(0)の最大サイズ（グリッドスペース）です。

source_text: A $(l:components/socket#large)$(item)Large CAD Socket$(0)$(/l), augmented with a $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigem$(0)$(/l), becomes the imaginatively-named $(item)Huge CAD Socket$(0).$(p)One of these doesn't have the $(l:basics/tutorial_5#bandwidth)$(thing)Bandwidth$(0)$(/l) of its $(l:components/socket#transmissive)$(item)Transmissive$(0)$(/l) counterpart (only $(thing)Spells$(0) that are 8x8 or smaller), but can store up to a full dozen $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 大型CADソケットを拡張することで、巨大なCADソケットになります。

source_text: The $(item)Basic CAD Socket$(0) is the simplest of $(thing)Sockets$(0), crafted from $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l) on a substrate of $(item)Iron$(0).$(p)It holds up to four $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) at a time, and can transfer $(thing)Spells$(0) up to 5x5 in size.
target_text: 基本CADソケットはソケットの最も単純で、鉄の基板にサイダストから作成されます。

source_text: Replacing the $(item)Iron$(0) substrate in a $(thing)Socket$(0) with a metal that's more conductive to $(thing)Psi energy$(0) (i.e. $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l)) allows us to choose a different dust to interface with the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l).$(p)Using $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) gets us a $(item)Signaling CAD Socket$(0), which holds up to six $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l), each with a $(thing)Spell$(0) up to 7x7 in size.
target_text: ソケットの鉄の基板をサイエネルギーの伝導性が高い金属に置き換えると、より多くのデータを転送できます。

source_text: Placing $(item)Glowstone Dust$(0) on a $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l) substrate creates a $(item)Large CAD Socket$(0).$(p)This $(thing)Socket$(0) can't handle $(thing)Spells$(0) as large as its $(l:components/socket#signaling)$(item)Signaling$(0)$(/l) counterpart can, only managing those up to 6x6 in size, but can hold up to eight $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l) at a time.
target_text: グロースストーンダストをサイメタル基板に配置すると、大型CADソケットが作成されます。

source_text: Augmenting a $(thing)Socket$(0) in its recipe with a $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigem$(0)$(/l) makes it transfer a lot more data, a lot faster.$(p)A $(l:components/socket#signaling)$(item)Signaling CAD Socket$(0)$(/l) with such an augmentation becomes a $(item)Transmissive CAD Socket$(0), which can hold up to ten $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Bullets$(0)$(/l), and can in fact handle $(o)any$() $(thing)Spell$(0) that fits in a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l).
target_text: ソケットをレシピで拡張することで、はるかに多くのデータをより高速に転送できます。

source_text: Every type of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) is crafted with an $(item)Iron Ingot$(0) and a piece of $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l), horizontally placed in a crafting grid.$(p)If nothing else is added to the recipe, this yields the most basic type of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0), (somewhat confusingly) just called the $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l).$(p)Other types of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) require one more ingredient, placed horizontally adjacent to the $(item)Iron Ingot$(0).
target_text: すべての型の呪文弾は鉄インゴットとサイダストの一片を使用して製造されます。

source_text: The ingredients for other types of $(thing)Spell Bullets$(0) are as follows:$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/projectile_bullet)$(item)Projectile Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs some kind of $(item)Arrow$(0),$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/loopcast_bullet)$(item)Loopcast Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs a piece of $(item)String$(0),$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/circle_bullet)$(item)Circle Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs, well, something circular (a $(item)Snowball$(0) or a $(item)Slimeball$(0)),$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/grenade_bullet)$(item)Grenade Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs a piece of $(item)Gunpowder$(0),$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/charge_bullet)$(item)Charge Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs a piece of $(item)Redstone Dust$(0), and$(p)$(li)a $(l:items/mine_bullet)$(item)Mine Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) needs some kind of $(item)Button$(0).
target_text: 他の種類の呪文弾の材料は以下の通りです。

source_text: Before a $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) can be loaded into a $(thing)CAD$(0), it needs to have a $(thing)Spell$(0) stored on it.$(p)To store a $(thing)Spell$(0) on a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l) in a $(thing)Bullet$(0), just swipe the $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) over the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l) ($(k:use)).$(p)A $(thing)Spell$(0) stored in a $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) can be copied into an empty $(l:items/spell_drive)$(item)Spell Drive$(0)$(/l) in a crafting grid for storage purposes.
target_text: 呪文弾をCADに装填する前に、それは呪文が格納されている必要があります。

source_text: A $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l) displays a $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) for any $(thing)Spell$(0) it compiles successfully-- yet for different types of $(thing)Bullets$(0), this $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) can be different.$(p)The $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l)'s value is calibrated to the most basic type of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0), (somewhat confusingly) just called the $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 呪文プログラマーは、正常にコンパイルされた呪文のコストを表示します。

source_text: All other types of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) display a $(thing)Cost Multiplier$(0) in percentage, which can simply be multiplied by the cost displayed on the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l) to determine the $(thing)Spell$(0)'s true $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) for that $(thing)Bullet$(0) type.$(p)For example, if a $(thing)Spell$(0) displays a final cost of 300 in a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l), when copied into a $(l:items/projectile_bullet)$(item)Projectile Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) (with a $(thing)Cost Multiplier$(0) of 102%%) it would have a true $(l:basics/tutorial_5#cost)$(thing)Cost$(0)$(/l) of$(br)300 × 102%% = 306 $(thing)Psi energy$(0) per cast.
target_text: 他のすべての型の呪文弾は、パーセンテージでコスト乗数を表示します。

source_text: The location of a $(thing)Focal Point$(0) depends on the type of $(thing)Spell Bullet$(0) it's cast from.$(p)The basic $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l)'s $(thing)Focal Point$(0) is simply the caster of the $(thing)Spell$(0), but other types of $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) can create different $(thing)Focal Points$(0).$(p)For example, a $(l:items/projectile_bullet)$(item)Projectile Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l)'s $(thing)Focal Point$(0) is the projectile itself.$(p)For more info on each $(thing)Bullet$(0) type's $(thing)Focal Points$(0) and quirks, consult individual entries.
target_text: 焦点の位置は、キャスト対象の呪文弾の型に依存します。

source_text: A $(item)Spell Drive$(0), crafted from two ingots of $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l) and a piece of $(item)Redstone Dust$(0), can store a single $(thing)Spell$(0) for later use.$(p)To store a $(thing)Spell$(0) in a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l) onto a $(item)Drive$(0), crouch and swipe ($(k:use)) an empty $(item)Drive$(0) over it.$(p)To copy a $(thing)Spell$(0) back, crouch-swipe a $(item)Drive$(0) with a $(thing)Spell$(0) stored over the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 呪文ドライブは、サイメタルの2つのインゴットとレッドストーンダストの一片から作成され、単一の呪文を後で使用するために保存できます。

source_text: To clear a stored $(thing)Spell$(0), crouch-swipe the $(item)Drive$(0) over any other block.$(p)A $(item)Drive$(0) with a stored $(thing)Spell$(0) can be placed in a crafting grid with an empty $(item)Drive$(0) or $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) to copy its $(thing)Spell$(0) onto the latter.
target_text: 保存された呪文をクリアするには、ドライブを他のブロック上でしゃがみながらスワイプします。

source_text: If the $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l) is the heart of $(thing)Psi$(0), then the $(item)Spell Programmer$(0) is the brains of the mod. It's where $(thing)Spells$(0) are written and compiled, and eventually copied into $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) to be cast.$(p)When placed and opened ($(k:use)), it displays a large 9x9 grid; see $(l:basics/tutorial_1)the tutorial entries$(/l) for more in-depth knowledge on using this grid.
target_text: CADアセンブラーがサイの心臓である場合、呪文プログラマーはModの脳です。

source_text: The $(thing)Psimetal Tools$(0) are a set of tools, comparable to $(item)Diamond$(0)-tier in quality, each of which can cast a $(thing)Spell$(0) each time it performs its intended action.$(p)All $(thing)Psimetal Tools$(0) are crafted with $(item)Iron Ingots$(0) in place of $(item)Sticks$(0), one $(l:components/psigem)$(item)Psigem$(0)$(/l), and some $(l:components/psimetal)$(item)Psimetal$(0)$(/l).
target_text: サイメタルツールは一連のツールで、ダイヤモンドレベルの品質に匹敵し、それぞれが意図されたアクションを実行するたびに呪文をキャストできます。

source_text: A $(thing)Psimetal Tool$(0) can be loaded with up to three $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) in a $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l) (though some $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) don't play well with the tools).$(p)To select the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) to use for a tool, hold the $(thing)Psi master keybind$(0) ($(k:psimisc.keybind)) and select from the menu as usual.$(p)Picking an empty slot from the menu disables the tool from casting entirely.
target_text: サイメタルツールはCADアセンブラーで最大3つの呪文弾を装填できます。

source_text: $(o)Note that many keywords in $(item)colored$(0) $(piece)text$(0) are links, and can be clicked on to learn more about their respective items or concepts.$()$(p)To get started with $(thing)Spell$(0) programming, you'll need (duh) a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l).$(p)Additionally, to actually execute your $(thing)Spells$(0), you'll need a better $(thing)CAD$(0) than the one you have right now-- you can construct one in your $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l).
target_text: 注意：色付きテキストの多くのキーワードはリンクであり、クリックしてそれぞれのアイテムまたは概念について詳しく知ることができます。

source_text: If at any time the X is present (which means that the compilation $(l)failed$() or $(l)errored$()), you can hover over it to see the problem with your $(thing)Spell$(0) and correct that problem.$(p)Once your $(thing)Spell$(0) compiles successfully, it can be copied into a $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) and cast. And that's exactly what we'll do in $(l:basics/tutorial_2)the next tutorial$(/l)!
target_text: いつでもXが存在する場合、ホバーして呪文に関する問題を確認できます。

source_text: To that end, you probably want to make a $(l:components/core#basic)$(item)Basic CAD Core$(0)$(/l) and $(l:components/socket#basic)$(item)Basic CAD Socket$(0)$(/l).$(p)You don't have to make another $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)Assembly$(0)$(/l); you can put your current $(thing)CAD$(0) in a crafting grid to revert it back to one (since it's pretty much just an $(l:components/assembly)$(thing)Assembly$(0)$(/l) anyway).$(p)Additionally, $(thing)Spells$(0) can't be cast directly out of a $(thing)CAD$(0); instead they're stored in $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l), so to get rolling you'll need a small handful of those as well.
target_text: そのためには、おそらく基本CADコアと基本CADソケットを作成したいと思うでしょう。

source_text: Once all your materials are gathered, the standard workflow for $(thing)Spell$(0) creation goes as follows:$(p)$(li)Construct a $(thing)Spell$(0) in the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l);$(br)$(li)Copy the $(thing)Spell$(0) into a $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l);$(br)$(li)Load the $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) into your $(thing)CAD$(0) using the $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l);$(br)$(li)Hold your $(thing)CAD$(0), point, and cast.$(p)In this tutorial and the next, we'll walk you through this process.
target_text: すべての材料を集めたら、呪文作成の標準ワークフローは以下の通りです。

source_text: $(thing)Psi$(0)'s $(thing)Spells$(0) are all created on the $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Programmer$(0)$(/l)'s grid from $(thing)Spell Pieces$(0); you can add as many pieces of as many types to a grid as you want, though not all arrangements of $(thing)Spell Pieces$(0) will produce valid $(thing)Spells$(0).$(p)To add a piece to the grid, right-click where you want the piece to go, and select from the menu of pieces that pops up.
target_text: サイの呪文はすべてプログラマーのグリッドから呪文ピースで作成されます。

source_text: So, you've written your first $(thing)Spell$(0)! Actually casting it, though, will take a few extra steps.$(p)First, close out your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l), hold a $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) (which you should have prepared in the last tutorial), and use ($(k:use)) the bullet on the Programmer. You should hear a chime, and the bullet should rename itself to "Debug."
target_text: だから、あなたは最初の呪文を書きました！実際にキャストするには、いくつかの追加の手順が必要になります。

source_text: The bullet now contains a copy of the $(thing)Spell$(0) you've written, and is ready to be loaded into your $(thing)CAD$(0).$(p)To load a $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l) into your $(thing)CAD$(0), open your $(l:basics/cad_assembler)$(item)CAD Assembler$(0)$(/l) and insert your $(thing)CAD$(0) into the leftmost slot. Some of the slots below it should open; place the bullet with the $(thing)Spell$(0) you've written in one of these slots. Take your $(thing)CAD$(0) back out.
target_text: 弾は現在書いた呪文のコピーを含んでおり、CADに装填される準備ができています。

source_text: $(thing)CADs$(0) can hold multiple $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l), and therefore multiple $(thing)Spells$(0); the active $(thing)Spell$(0) to be cast can be switched on-the-fly.$(p)To select a $(thing)Spell$(0) to cast, hold your $(thing)CAD$(0) in either hand and hold down the $(thing)Psi master keybind$(0) ($(k:psimisc.keybind)).$(p)A HUD should appear; hover over the $(thing)Spell$(0) labeled "Debug" (the one you just wrote) and release the key to select it.
target_text: CADは複数の呪文弾を保持でき、したがって複数の呪文を保持します。

source_text: When you cast the $(thing)Spell$(0) ($(k:use)), you should see displayed in chat a long block of text that includes your username and coordinates. If so: congratulations! You've managed to write and cast your first $(thing)Spell$(0)!$(p)If you need to craft more $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l), re-open the HUD and select a slot without a $(thing)Spell$(0) stored, then cast at $(item)Redstone Dust$(0) as you normally would.
target_text: 呪文をキャストすると、チャットに表示される長いテキストブロックにユーザー名と座標が含まれています。

source_text: Finally, for the last parameter of $(piece)Trick: Add Motion$(0), a simple $(piece)Constant: Number$(0) will do.$(p)Let's put this $(thing)Spell$(0) all together: first, open up your $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l) and clear any $(thing)Spell$(0) currently on it. Then, place a $(piece)Trick: Add Motion$(0) near the middle of the grid.
target_text: 最後に、トリック：モーション追加の最後のパラメーターについては、単純な定数：番号で構いません。

source_text: There's one final limitation on $(thing)Spells$(0): no $(thing)Trick$(0) can affect anything more than 32 blocks away from its $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Point$(0)$(/l) (for a plain $(l:items/basic_bullet)$(item)Spell Bullet$(0)$(/l), that's just you, the caster), excepting the caster of the $(thing)Spell$(0) themself.$(p)A $(thing)Spell$(0) that attempts to do so will display an error in chat, then $(l)fizzle$().$(p)When a $(thing)Spell$(0) fizzles, it harmlessly disperses its stored $(thing)Psi energy$(0), and any remaining $(thing)Tricks$(0) it would otherwise execute don't happen.
target_text: 呪文には最後の制限があります。

source_text: To clarify the earlier exception mentioned:$(br)Certain types of $(l:items/spell_bullet)$(thing)Spell Bullets$(0)$(/l) have $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Points$(0)$(/l) that $(o)aren't$() their casters-- yet in these cases, their stored $(thing)Spells$(0) can still affect their casters through $(piece)Selector: Caster$(0), no matter how far away their $(l:items/spell_bullet#focal_point)$(thing)Focal Points$(0)$(/l) are.$(p)There's $(l:basics/tutorial_6)one final tutorial$(/l) lined up, putting most of what we've learned together, and then we'll cut you loose into the wider world of $(thing)Psi$(0). Good luck!
target_text: 以前述べた例外を明確にするために。

source_text: This concludes this set of tutorials!$(p)Have a read through the rest of this book for an idea of exactly what you can do with this mod. Experienced mages can do terrifying things, after all.$(p)It's up to you to experiment with your $(thing)CAD$(0) and $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l), and to create your own unique $(thing)Spells$(0).$(p)Good luck, and welcome to the wide world of $(thing)Psi$(0)!
target_text: このチュートリアルセットは以上です！

source_text: Unit vectors have a fixed magnitude, so they only represent direction.$(p)Many $(thing)Spell Pieces$(0) related to direction return unit vectors, like $(piece)Operator: Vector Axis Raycast$(0) and $(piece)Operator: Entity Look$(0).$(p)Indeed, there are $(thing)Operators$(0) to do $(o)most$() of the vector operations laid out in this article, usually with self-explanatory names.
target_text: ユニットベクトルは固定された大きさを持っているため、方向のみを表します。

source_text: The operations and their corresponding $(thing)Operators$(0) are as follows:$(p)$(li)Negating is $(piece)Operator: Vector Negate$(0);$(p)$(li)Normalizing is $(piece)Operator: Vector Normalize$(0);$(p)$(li)Scaling is $(piece)Operator: Vector Multiply$(0) and $(piece)Operator: Vector Divide$(0);$(p)$(li)Taking the magnitude is $(piece)Operator: Vector Magnitude$(0);$(p)$(li)Adding is $(piece)Operator: Vector Sum$(0);$(p)$(li)Subtracting is $(piece)Operator: Vector Subtract$(0).
target_text: 操作と対応する$(thing)オペレーター$(0)は次のとおりです。

source_text: Finally: vectors are still lists of three numbers. Don't lose sight of that.$(p)In a $(l:basics/spell_programmer)$(item)Spell Programmer$(0)$(/l), they can be constructed from up to three numbers with $(piece)Operator: Vector Construct$(0).$(p)Conversely, a vector can also be broken back down into numbers with $(piece)Operator: Extract X$(0), $(piece)Operator: Extract Y$(0), and $(piece)Operator: Extract Z$(0).
target_text: 最後に：ベクトルはまだ3つの数値のリストです。

source_text: A $(item)Vector Ruler$(0) can store an arbitrary vector, which can then be accessed from within a $(thing)Spell$(0) at your convenience.$(p)It's made from $(item)Iron Ingots$(0) and a tip of $(l:components/psidust)$(item)Psidust$(0)$(/l).
target_text: $(item)ベクトルルーラー$(0)は任意のベクトルを保存でき、その後、$(thing)呪文$(0)内からご都合の良い時に アクセスできます。
